g.text: interaction can occur [62–66]. While flake-like graphite particles have higher gravimetric capacity at
higher C-rate compared to spherical particles [67]. Although the crystal structure of the anode typically
does not change with aging, a change in the rhombohederal/hexagonal content during battery operation
has been reported. The increase in the hexagonal content during the first and third stage of lithium ions
intercalation lowers Faradic efficiency, thereby decreasing the reversible capacity of the anode [68–70],
so ideally a high ratio of rhombohederal/hexagonal content which gives a high reversible capacity is

on the sufrcae of aged anode electrode; (
) XRD spectra of aged anode electrode showing
6. Influence of Particle Size, Active Surface Area and Porosity
The size of the graphite particles in the anode greatly influences the performance of the anode.
Small particles contain short diffusion paths between the graphite particles, which facilitate fast charge
and discharge rate [71]. Similarly, the larger surface area of the smaller graphite particles are prone to
higher internal heat generation and lithium ion are consumed during the exothermic reaction at high
